news.title: U.S. added just 73,000 jobs in July and numbers for prior months were revised much lower
news.summary: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 100,000 in July, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate. The economy is expected to grow by 0.4 percent in July.

news.title: Fed governors Bowman, Waller explain their dissents, say waiting to cut rates threatens economy
news.summary: Two Federal Reserve officials who voted against holding a key interest rate explained their decisions Friday. Two Fed officials voted this week against holding an interest rate in place.

news.title: Ray Dalio sells his last remaining stake in Bridgewater, steps away from hedge fund's board
news.summary: Bridgewater completed the final transition of Dalio's equity shares, wrapping up his management transition started in 2022. Dalio will remain as a non-executive director of Bridgewater until at least 2018.

news.title: Millions of student loan borrowers could see their debt grow as interest-free break ends
news.summary: Borrowers who remain in the so-called SAVE forbearance could see their education debt grow if they don't make payments large enough to cover accruing interest.

news.title: How much are Southwest's new assigned seats? It depends
news.summary: Southwest put its first-ever assigned seats on sale this week. The move ends more than half a century of open seating on the airline.

news.title: Student-loan interest restarts today for millions. This is what you can do.
news.summary: Borrowers enrolled in the SAVE plan will see their balances start to tick up. Borrowers will be able to pay back the money they borrowed through the plan.

news.title: I’m in my 60s. My salary is not keeping up with inflation. Do I jump ship?
news.summary: “If my salary had kept pace with inflation, I would be earning an additional $17,000 a year,” she says.

news.title: Switzerland shocked by 39% Trump tariffs. One economist says America isn’t the ‘big market’ it used to be.
news.summary: Switzerland was looking at a 31% tariff rate for its exports to the U.S. That's now 39% barring a further deal, and some are reeling.

news.title: ‘I told him that wouldn’t fly’: My 90-year-old mother’s adviser pushed her to change her beneficiaries. What is going on?
news.summary: “He said, ‘I’m just trying to help.’” she says of the man who tried to help her.

news.title: Will your spouse automatically inherit your 401(k)?
news.summary: "What happens if the participant gets married again, but doesn’t update the beneficiary to be their new spouse? “ asks the lawyer. “What happens If the participant Gets Married Again, but Doesn't Update the Beneficiary to be Their New spouse?"
